page.title: 04FARMING STRACATHRO
page.content:
Colin writes,
If you took a walk round our area, you might smell the scent of oil-seed rape in the fields , or grass after it has been cut for silage, or even tar melting on the road in the sun. You might smell dung spread on a field or flowers from the village gardens.
In the autumn you would enjoy the aroma of jam cooking in a country cottage or the smell of the earth where the potatoes are being gathered by the happy children, free from school for a fortnight.
Winter brings the cheerful scent of wood smoke or even peat-reek from cosy centrally-heated homes.
